intro: Xanthostachya aspera, commonly known as the rough xanthostachya, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. The plant is characterized by its erect, cylindrical stems and narrow, rough-textured leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of spikelets, which are covered in short, bristly hairs. Xanthostachya aspera is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid conditions.
